p: Less calcium intake has been shown in people who follow a vegetarian diet, than in omnivores [ 74]. Calcium intake in vegetarians can be up to 25% less than in omnivores and its sources come mainly from fortified plant-based drinks. Therefore, it is recommended for plant-based consumers to choose plant-based foods that are rich in calcium but most importantly, with high bioavailability as well as choosing fortified food products to avoid calcium deficiency and bone health maintenance [ 69, 74, 80].
